details.purpose: To document an overall impression of the patient as part of examination
details.use: Use in conjunction with Conscious state OBSERVATION

items.items: General assessment of the whole patient by the clinician - usually these consist of obvious apparent features as the patient enters the consulting room and in the course of taking the history
Estimated age from appearance of patient and based on direct inspection
Estimation of apparent age compared to known age based on inspection
Observation of appearance of patient compared to known age
Description of patient's state and condition of clothing
Behaviour is observed as normal and appropriate
Description of observed unusual, abnormal or inappropriate behaviour
Clinical description of generalised abnormal body movements
A statement about normal appearance and behaviour
General description of the global impression of the patient
Requires the use of a mobility aid
Description of ability to move independently
